protocol.name: P-MEXP-2796
protocol.text: Expression analysis was performed using RMAExpress (02 release) using the background correction and quantile normalisation options (Bolstad, B.M., Irizarry R. A., Astrand, M., and Speed, T.P. (2003), A Comparison of Normalization Methods for High Density Oligonucleotide Array Data Based on Bias and Variance. Bioinformatics 19(2):185-193). In addition, scaling normalisation (target signal 100) using Affymetrix MAS 5.1 was done for the .CHP files submitted to this database.

protocol.name: P-MEXP-6065
text: 1. Synthesise cDNA with Superscript Double-Stranded cDNA Synthesis kit (Invitrogen, UK).
2. Synthesise cRNA using the BioArray High Yield RNA transcript Labeling kit (Enzo Life Sciences Inc., NY).

protocol.name: P-MEXP-7305
protocol.text: Whole plants were removed from the soil and hypocotyls cut from the plant. Root material surrounding the hypocotyl was removed, the hypocotyl was washed with distilled water, dried and then immediately frozen in liquid nitrogen. The material was stored at -80oC until RNA extraction.

protocol.name: P-MEXP-7306
protocol.text: The third true leaf was harvested and immediately frozen in liquid nitrogen and then stored at -80oC until RNA extraction.

protocol.name: P-MEXP-7307
protocol.text: The siliques and flowers of the inflorescence stem were removed prior to the stem being divided into 4 sections of equal length. The base section was immediately frozen in liquid nitrogen and then stored at -80oC until RNAextraction.

protocol.name: P-MEXP-7308
protocol.text: The siliques and flowers of the inflorescence stem were removed prior to the stem being divided into 4 sections of equal length. The lower middle section was immediately frozen in liquid nitrogen and then stored at -80oC until RNAextraction.

protocol.name: P-MEXP-7309
protocol.text: The siliques and flowers of the inflorescence stem were removed prior to the stem being divided into 4 sections of equal length. The upper middle section was immediately frozen in liquid nitrogen and then stored at -80oC until RNAextraction.

protocol.name: P-MEXP-7310
protocol.text: The siliques and flowers of the inflorescence stem were removed prior to the stem being divided into 4 sections of equal length. The tip section was immediately frozen in liquid nitrogen and then stored at -80oC until RNAextraction.

protocol.name: P-MEXP-7311
protocol.text: Material from 9 plants was pooled. Total RNA extracted and purified with an RNeasy Plant Mini Kit (Qiagen, Hilden, Germany) according to manufacturer’s instructions. Resuspend in 50ul of array quality water. Synthesise cDNA with Superscript Double-Stranded cDNA Synthesis kit (Invitrogen, UK). Synthesise cRNA using the BioArray High Yield RNA transcript Labeling kit (Enzo Life Sciences Inc., NY) and apply to microarray. The experiment was performed in triplicate for each plant section using three independent pools of 9 plants i.e. biological replicates.

protocol.name: P-MEXP-7312
protocol.text: Material from 9 plants was pooled. Total RNA extracted and purified with an RNeasy Plant Mini Kit (Qiagen, Hilden, Germany) according to manufacturer’s instructions. Resuspend in 50ul of array quality water. Synthesise cDNA with Superscript Double-Stranded cDNA Synthesis kit (Invitrogen, UK). Synthesise cRNA using the BioArray High Yield RNA transcript Labeling kit (Enzo Life Sciences Inc., NY) and applied to microarray.

protocol.name: P-MEXP-7314
protocol.text: Arabidopsis (Lansberg-0 wt) plants were germinated and grown on plates containing 0.8-1.0% agar (w/v) and MS media with B5 vitamins for 11 daysprior to transferring 9 plants to a 4 inch pot containing compost with vermiculite and perlite (10:1:1). They were then grown in continuous light at 22oC in controlled environment cabinets (Percival, Ohio, USA) at a light intensity of 120-150 µE m-2. Material for the study of stem development was grown until the inflorescence stem contained 2 – 3 expanded siliques (18 days on soil). The siliques and flowers were removed prior to the stems being divided into 4 sections of equal length. Hypocotyls and leaves were harvested at the same developmental stage as stems.
